The banks happily went along with it because the federal government GUARANTEED those loans with PUBLIC MONEY.  The fact that these ridiculous loans were undersigned by the general public via the FEDERAL GOVERNMENT in the event of a collapse is what fueled the "greed" - making it possible for banks to hand out loans like candy, repackage and sell those loans by virtue of a FULL ASSURANCE OF THEIR SOLVENCY BY THE U.S. GOVERNMENT, and make a killing for them AND THEIR CRONIES IN POLITICS in the process.   Of course the whole thing had to come crashing down, but blaming it merely on the "greed" of the banks is a great way for us to do it all again. FOR THE WHOLE PROCESS CONTINUES. The Federal Reserve is corrupt. The government "management" of the economy is corrupt. We are in another bubble RIGHT NOW due to the government artificially inflating a bubble via their manipulation of our currency. It is NOT more regulation that is needed - it is a TRUE FREE MARKET removed from the machinations of government, wherein money is treated like any other good or service and banks must be responsible for the loans they make - NOT GUARANTEED A government handout! (Also, fraud is fraud and is always prosecutable- which is a process that is more transparent and effective in a TRUE FREE MARKET.)  THIS PROBLEM STARTS WITH OUR GOVERNMENT. If people do not see the proper cause-and-effect then we have learned NOTHING from the recent economic meltdown and will be destined to repeat it again and again, each time shaking our heads like children about "greed" when we continually fail to see the real source of the problem.  One more thing. It wasn't just a guy who "gets his hair cut at supercuts and doesn't wear shoes" who could see the collapse coming- IT WAS THE ENTIRE SCHOOL OF AUSTRIAN ECONOMISTS. Only these are NOT the economists in power. The Austrian school promotes a fair and prosperous system, not the sort of currency manipulation and devious legislation beloved by the politicians and their crony capitalist partners who run the show and have an utter disdain for the common person.  A good primer on the events covered in this movie is Tom Wood's book "Meltdown."  The American people need to wake up to the fraud that is the COLLUSION between government and big banks, bankers should be prosecuted, nefarious legislation limiting the proper functioning of the market removed, economically ignorant, greedy politicians should be replaced and the Federal Reserve should be dealt with.   I hope this film reveals at least some of the actual dynamics at work to create this crisis, but I doubt it will. The scumbags who have created this mess are able to continue in power in part by their control of the media. text: Read "Bull by the Horns."  This was the biggest financial fraud in modern history.    First the banksters invented and pushed toxic mortgage programs that were destined, if not designed, to fail or require costly refinances setting up a self-perpetuating cycle of even more fees. Examples were interest only, negative amortization, no tax and insurance escrows, no qualifying, and teaser low beginning interest rates - all promoted with a wink and a nod:  ‚ÄúDon't worry, if it gets tough, we'll just refinance you into another lower rate."  Unsuspecting borrowers pushed to the bankster/realtor controlled lender and title company had no one to look out for their interest.  They believed the sales pitch and signed up.  An inherently dangerous product was sold to the public as safe - much like the unsafe-at-any-speed Chevrolet Corvair.  Evidence now suggests that a majority of the sub-prime loans were made to people who would have qualified for a decent loan but were pushed into the more-profitable, but toxic, sub-prime.   Second, the banksters packaged this garbage into bonds, paid for a AAA rating, then sold the stinking poo to unsuspecting investors while retaining the lucrative servicing rights and senior positions for themselves.   Third, the banksters developed a scheme (MERS) that was supposed to keep track of the swirl of paperwork as they whipped these loans and bonds around the world while defrauding local courts of millions of dollars in transfer taxes. Talk about tax evasion!  Lastly, when the whole thing unravels, the banksters have lost the paperwork, don't know who owns what, can't understand how it all went so wrong and won't negotiate to help people keep their homes.
